name: tiilda mittens
notes:
*you can also download the matching free [tiilda hat](/patterns/library/tiilda-hat) pattern.*

**tiilda mittens** 
inspired by the serene peacefulness of winter mornings, the gentle crunch of the snow under the feet, an odd snow load softly falling off a tree branch, the tingling frost on the tip of the nose and the warm hands hugged by a wooly comfort. that's how i remember my childhood winter mornings after the snowstorms - quiet, white and so beautiful. 
tiilda mittens are a simple, joyous project to get you through a few dark winter evenings and after they're done - through many, many white winter days. 

the pattern includes written instructions and cable pattern chart.

**size** 
one size - to fit 7" - 7.5" (18cm - 19cm) hand circumference  

**yarn & yardage** 
deramores vintage chunky, 50% merino wool, 50% acrylic, 153yards (140m) per 100gr ball. 
1 ball in colour chalk.  
or 
bulky (chunky) weight yarn. approximately 120-130 yards (110m-120m). 

**needles** 
us 6/ 4mm circulars with 32" (80cm) cable
us 8/ 5mm circulars with 32" (80cm) cable
gauge 
15 stitches and 22 rows to 4‚Äù (10cm) in larger size needles

**notions** 
cable needle, stitch marker, tapestry needle, scarp yarn
